definition: lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)

sentences.english: But what if you’re feeling grouchy?
sentences.chinese: 如果你自己都满腹牢骚情况会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: For my dream i will grin and bear it, without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个梦想我要任劳任怨不再满腹牢骚。

sentences.english: Timid people always wreak their peevishness on the gentle.
sentences.chinese: 怯懦的人总是把满腹牢骚向温和的人发泄。

sentences.english: You sound like a whiny brat.
sentences.chinese: 你就像一个满腹牢骚的小屁孩。

sentences.english: A hen and a cow are chatting, both full of grievance.
sentences.chinese: 鸡和牛满腹牢骚在闲聊。

sentences.english: The lion wearied Jupiter (1) with his frequent complaints.
sentences.chinese: 狮子满腹牢骚，使丘比特感到厌烦。

sentences.english: The lion wearied Jupiter with his frequent complaints.
sentences.chinese: 狮子满腹牢骚，使丘比特感到厌烦。

definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
